1.text: Therefore setting aside all wickedness, and all artifice, and dissimulation; and envies, and all calumnies,

2.text: As new born babes, long for the sincere milk pertaining to the word, that ye might be nourished with it:

3.text: If ye have tasted that the Lord is good.

4.text: To whom approaching, a living stone, truly disapproved of by men, and chosen by God, highly valued,

5.text: And ye yourselves are built, as living stones, a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to bring up spiritual sacrifice; acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

6.text: Wherefore also it holds in the writing, Behold, I place in Zion a corner stone, chosen, highly valued: and he believing on him shall not be ashamed.

7.text: Therefore honour to you believing: and to the unbelieving, the stone which the builders disapproved of has become the head of the corner,

8.text: And a stone of stumble, and rock of offence, they disbelieving the word stumble: to which also they were set.

9.text: And ye a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for acquisition; so that ye should proclaim the excellencies of him having called you out of darkness into his wonderful light:

10.text: Who once not a people, and now the people of God: they not commiserated, and now commiserated.

11.text: Dearly beloved, I beseech as sojourners and strangers, to keep off from fleshly passions, which war against the soul;

12.text: Having your turning back good in the nations: that, in what they speak against you as doing evil, from good works, they having beheld, might praise God in the day of inspection.

13.text: Be subjected to every creation proceeding from man on account of the Lord: whether to the king, as having superiority;

14.text: Or to chiefs, as sent by him for the punishing of them doing evil, and the praise of them doing good.

15.text: (For so is the will of God, those doing good to silence the want of knowledge of the foolish men:)

16.text: As free, and as not having liberty for a covering of wickedness, but as the servants of God.

17.text: Honour all. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.

18.text: Servants being subjected to masters in all fear; not only to the good and equitable, but also to the crooked.

19.text: For this is grace, if any by consciousness of God bear grief, suffering unjustly.

20.text: For what glory, if, sinning and being cuffed, ye endure? but if, doing good, and suffering, ye endure, this is grace with God.

21.text: For to this were ye called: for also Christ suffered for you, leaving behind to you an underwriting, that ye should follow upon his footsteps:

22.text: Who did no sin, nor was deceit found in his mouth:

23.text: Who, being reviled, reviled not back; suffering, he threatened not; and delivered to him judging justly;

24.text: Who himself bear up our sins in his body upon the wood, that we, removed from sins, should live to justice: by whose bloody mark ye were healed.

25.text: For ye were as sheep going astray; but now have turned about to the Shepherd and inspector of your souls.
